executive_summary: Sanket Gaikwad is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) diagnosed in 2022. His current HbA1c is 7.5%, which is above the target, indicating a need for improved glycemic control and lifestyle modifications.

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c of 7.5% indicates suboptimal glycemic control.
interpretation.plan: Implement lifestyle modifications and consider medication for better control.

interpretation.assessment: LDL level of 2.5 is above the target of 2.0.
interpretation.plan: Advise dietary changes to lower LDL levels.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Aim for a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on a low glycemic index diet, reduce saturated fats, and increase fiber intake.
sample_meals: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens and vinaigrette
Oatmeal topped with berries and nuts
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use a plate method: half the plate for vegetables, a quarter for protein, and a quarter for whole grains.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels of 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia and monitor HbA1c every 3 months.

patient_goals: Reduce HbA1c to below 7.0% within 3 months.
Lower LDL cholesterol to below 2.0 within 6 months.
Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes per week.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy to improve glycemic control.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c and lipid levels, and review lifestyle changes.

emr_note: Patient is a 43-year-old male with T1DM, currently with an HbA1c of 7.5%. Lifestyle modifications and potential insulin therapy recommended for better glycemic control.
